intro: Collaea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved collaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open woodlands or heathlands. Collaea lancifolia is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand salt spray and drought conditions.
